newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU reaches provisional animal feed label agreement.
newsitem.headline: EU reaches provisional animal feed label agreement.

text.p: Agreement in principle has been reached on new animal feed labelling rules that eliminate the "animal proteins" category, a European Commission official recently told the EU feedingstuffs committee.
EU member states will have 90 days in which to gather trade, industry and consumer reaction after which a final decision will be taken, according to minutes of the meeting.
Member states were also pressing for the abolition of other labelling categories, oils and fats as well as minerals, and further changes could be made, the official added.
The Commission official said a proposal had been drawn up on "novel feed" -- containing genetically modified organisms -- but declined to give further details.
The EU last November agreed labelling rules for "novel foods" under which products containing "live" GMOs and differing substantially from the conventional would have to be labelled.
